alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 30 at 2:42PM MDT until October 01 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SUNDAY FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS... .A Pacific storm system will continue to move inland and strengthen over the Great Basin through Sunday. This disturbance will continue to spread strong winds, dry conditions, and unstable air over portions of northwestern to west central New Mexico today and Sunday. This will lead to areas of critical fire weather conditions, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. While these critical conditions may temporarily subside tonight, they will possibly redevelop Sunday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and West Central Mountains (Zone 105) from early afternoon through early this evening both today and Sunday, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph today, strengthening from the south at 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph on Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 13 to 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
